#Text=Use Bollinger Bands
#Text=Bollinger Bands are a relatively recent invention within the sphere of technical analysis to help investors assess holdings and plan for future capital gains .
#Text=Developed by financial analyst John Bollinger , the idea of Bollinger Bands establishes detailed future price probability data based on moving averages and fundamentals for a stock or fund .
#Text=For those who want to use Bollinger Bands for any kind of investment strategy , here are some critical steps for succeeding with analysis that includes these pricing tools .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Start with a time frame .
#Text=Like other analytical stock tools and moving averages , the Bollinger Bands are really only meaningful when applied to a specific timeline .
#Text=Choosing a window will help the investor more accurately describe what he or she sees in the activity of Bollinger Bands around an equity .
#Text=Understand the triple band setup of Bollinger Bands .
#Text=The basic explanation from established sources is that the middle band represents a simple moving average that impacts the upper and lower bands .
#Text=What all of this leads to is a projection of price probabilities based on established price movements .
#Text=Read about the use of the " envelope " for Bollinger Bands .
#Text=Traders often use Bollinger Bands to figure out relative highs and lows within a specific price environment .
#Text=The envelope represents a region within the parameters laid out by the bands that can help traders evaluate various prices .
#Text=Use Bollinger Bands within a good visual context .
#Text=The best uses of Bollinger Bands often include software designed to display equity prices to analysts , investors or others .
#Text=Include candlestick charting .
#Text=Candlestick charting , with its daily candle and wick design , provides all of the dynamic price movement in a market day ( or longer time period ) at a glance .
#Text=Mixing in Bollinger Bands with candlestick charting can provide more detail on which to base market decisions .
#Text=Apply Bollinger Bands to diversified holdings .
#Text=An investor who fails to develop a diversified portfolio is playing with fire no matter how analytical he/she gets .
#Text=Bollinger Bands and other tools will not guarantee you protection in a volatile market environment .
#Text=Be sure you have correctly weighted your portfolio among several asset classes .
#Text=Use Bollinger Bands with an overall trading strategy .
#Text=In addition to diversification , investors will want to have a specific trading philosophy and master plan in hand .
#Text=Without a desired goal , it 's hard to know when to sell equities for profit .
#Text=Bollinger Bands can help individuals get closer to identifying price movements , but gaining from them usually requires a good set of strategic plans .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Keep an international perspective .
#Text=Bollinger Bands can be applied to equities regardless of where they 're traded .
#Text=Learn to trade in international markets , including foreign currency exchanges .
#Text=Keep reading the opinions of various analysts .
#Text=With Bollinger Bands , it 's often how they are interpreted that counts .
#Text=Single investors should not base all of what they do on the opinions of others , but knowing how analysts view the use of Bollinger Bands in a given instance can be helpful .
